channel.title: Evil Cowgod - writing Black Book 7
channel.description:
Hi,
I'm Evil Cowgod. For those who don't know, I ran the main cheating forums around 2001-2003. I've always encouraged people to not trust anyone claiming to be me (although I doubt anyone would bother impersonating me now days), but we can fully prove my identity later. For now, just read the news flasher thingo from my original forum (the one where AutoRune was born): http://evilcowgod.conforums.com/ . I'll buzz Dylock and Kaitnieks when they come on MSN, but I'm not sure if they've kept any links to the community either.
I'm here looking for someone who's willing to pick up the Black Book where I left off. Hopefully I'll be able to find someone who's both keen to write, and whose word is respected by the community. I know nothing about what's happened since around the time Kaitnieks.com has died, and I'm not interested in a full return to cheating.
Right now, there's a partly written version 7, written back in the days of Kaitnieks.com. Those cheating historians amongst you may be asking "what about version 6?". A version 6 was actually officially released, but it sucked so much I recalled it. The contents of version 6 would presumably be released with version 7.
This thread isn't for recruitment (that'll come later), but more to see if people are interested.
Post your thoughts.

item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

I F’IN <3 YOU MAN!!!

the black book is a good read, despite the fact that i habitually lose it

I was a nobody back in the day, just a user of Nick’s autominer :rolleyes:

maybe i can get my hands on such ancient stuff that we used before nick’s miner was even released, hacked will look through his backup dvds since i lost mines would be interesting to combine stuff from those clickers to what you all use now, it’s like our times vs new ages

item.title: Evil Cowgod - writing Black Book 7
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Welcome back Cow, it is always great to have an old member return to the community. A new black book of cheating would be great, and I believe we have plenty of talent here to assist you. As for me, I have a good memory of most everything that has happened, but I am not a writer by any stretch of the word. If anyone writing for the book needs some more details on specific things feel free to get ahold of me.

Cow, it would be great to see you on the IRC channel, irc.moparisthebest.com #mopar

Read full topic

item.title: Evil Cowgod - writing Black Book 7
item.dc:creator: @Brazen_Bull Brazen Bull
item.description:
@Brazen_Bull wrote:

Exams over in a few days Then I should have some time to actually get something organised. If all goes well, I’ll find someone to write a chronological overview of the main events, and then find some people to write stand alone articles.

I’d like the book to give a sense of the history of cheating, as well as show people a few useful/cool things they mightn’t know.

Freddy1990:
If kaitnieks trusted you with SCAR, then you’ve got my trust immediately. Would you be interested in writing something about SCAR 3.06, or SCAR in general?

PaulT:
You cared enough about the book to spend a few hours on it. That alone was enough to make me happy Want to write something for the next version?

BanneD: I know you aren’t into cheating anymore, but ofcourse you’re welcome to contribute anything.

Read full topic

You miss 100% of the shots you never take, man.

item.title: Evil Cowgod - writing Black Book 7
item.dc:creator: @PaulT PaulT
item.description:
@PaulT wrote:

I just found out PaulT (I think that name's familiar, but I'm not sure) had released his own upate to the Black Book. It's strange that I'm the last person to hear about it, but to be fair it would have been nearly impossible to get in touch with me.

Yeah, I PMed you on Kaitnieks and asked your permission first. Anyway, I’m sorry I couldn’t make it up to standards, nobody else was stepping up and at that point you/everyone else was leaving the community, I felt I had to try. Anyway, good to see you back. Good luck!

Read full topic

item.title: Evil Cowgod - writing Black Book 7
item.dc:creator: @Tree Tree
item.description:
@Tree wrote:

[quote=“pplsuqbawlz, post:25, topic:109989”][quote author=Brazen Bull link=topic=157245.msg1479748#msg1479748 date=1181750396]

[quote author=Tree link=topic=157245.msg1479414#msg1479414 date=1181738698]
Lies, I’m Evil Cowgod. Tbh PSB or Semaphore would make perfect candidates. They can spell + know heaps about cheating lately.
[/quote]Hey! You were on kaitnieks.com right? Semaphore would be a good candidate, if he’s interested. He writes with a lot of flare.

[quote author=XxKanexX link=topic=157245.msg1479614#msg1479614 date=1181745563]
Ah, I remember you.[/quote]
Same, that was quite a night we had

Anyway, RSC cheating is relatively simplistic in comparison with RS2 cheating; the problem with those of us who have been around for more than 3 years is that we can remember the days when it took so little effort… I mean with Jagex making like 120 million a year off members it is only logical to protect there investment, is it not?
[/quote]Another familiar name

We can still run circles around Jagex though, right?

We can always run circles around any community. We’re simply lucky that Jagex uses the industry standard in obfuscation: Zelix Klassmaster… Other obfuscators are not only better but far more advanced and to put it simply, it’d put 99% of cheaters out of work.

A few patches to BCEL and most anyone can hack-it-up on RuneScape. I would like to see the Black-Book designed and written from both newcomers and “ancient” perspectives. Newcomers being semaphore for one, ancients being, well you I guess. (If you are who you say you are hehe… Too many scammers nowadays…)

Strange, we’ve both been around since 2001… Glad to see you coming back. I remember sitting in IRC wondering how the fuck to deob… And using/abusing ExaminDiff (with that gay little apple icon)… Haha then Aivars was just like “here” and sent me his cfparse + delphi source… Wish I saved a copy of it… Not to make light of the dead, but I remember how much of an ass Saevion could/would be and the fact that Aivars was the polar opposite; always thought it was weird how they managed to work together.[/quote]

Respect Brother. <3

Read full topic

We can still run circles around Jagex though, right?[/quote]
We can always run circles around any community. We’re simply lucky that Jagex uses the industry standard in obfuscation: Zelix Klassmaster… Other obfuscators are not only better but far more advanced and to put it simply, it’d put 99% of cheaters out of work.

A few patches to BCEL and most anyone can hack-it-up on RuneScape. I would like to see the Black-Book designed and written from both newcomers and “ancient” perspectives. Newcomers being semaphore for one, ancients being, well you I guess. (If you are who you say you are hehe… Too many scammers nowadays…)

Strange, we’ve both been around since 2001… Glad to see you coming back. I remember sitting in IRC wondering how the fuck to deob… And using/abusing ExaminDiff (with that gay little apple icon)… Haha then Aivars was just like “here” and sent me his cfparse + delphi source… Wish I saved a copy of it… Not to make light of the dead, but I remember how much of an ass Saevion could/would be and the fact that Aivars was the polar opposite; always thought it was weird how they managed to work together.

item.title: Evil Cowgod - writing Black Book 7
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

Problem is now, so much has happened in the past 2 years it would be incredibly easy to miss something out.

I agree with I think it was BeBe, in that contributions should come from several people and then a final editor puts it all together in sequence. A sort of first version can be released and if anythings missing people can step forward to fill in the gaps. Certainly the last couple of years has had it’s many ups and downs so it would make a very interesting read!

Good Luck to whoever takes on the task

Read full topic
